muddle.translation[0].definitions[0].def: when there is confusion about something, and things are done wrong as a result
muddle.translation[0].definitions[0].exa: Our accountant finally managed to sort out the muddle.
There was a bit of a muddle over our hotel reservations.
muddle.translation[1].definitions[0].def: to put things in the wrong order
muddle.translation[1].definitions[0].exa: Someone’s muddled up all the papers on my desk.
The government seems to have lost its way and muddled its priorities.
muddle.translation[1].definitions[1].def: to confuse one person or thing with another, and make a mistake
muddle.translation[1].definitions[1].exa: The twins are so alike that it’s easy to muddle them up.
Spanish and Italian are very similar and I sometimes get them muddled up.
Be careful not to muddle the files you’ve already worked on with the others.
muddle.translation[1].definitions[2].def: to confuse someone, especially so that they make a mistake
muddle.translation[1].definitions[2].exa: Don’t muddle her with all the extra details at the moment.
Could you just repeat those figures – I’ve got a bit muddled up.
